div.p: My name is Marketta, and I’m CEO of Go ON UK. Go ON UK is a charity and our aim is to
make the UK the most digitally capable nation in the world.
Core to our belief is a belief in digital by default. I think the important thing to
underscore there is digital by default; not digital only. So that means when we’re thinking
about how we’re conceiving of services for the future, we need to think about digital
at the heart because of what that can deliver in terms of customer experience and efficiency,
and a whole host of other things. That’s not to say there shouldn’t be support
for those can’t access the service. We think that that’s critical again as part of not
leaving anyone behind that that is catered for, and we know that assisted digital is
being addressed. We think that’s a critical part of the support that needs to be in place.
I suppose we would aim to get to 100% because we think that the internet is an amazing place
to be and we’d love for everyone to join. I think the reality is that some people might
opt out of that choice, but we’d like for that to be an active opt out, and informed
opt out. So fundamentally, we believe that no one deserves to be left behind because
of cost barriers, because the infrastructure isn’t there, because they haven’t the
skills. I think that’s the most important thing; it should be an active choice and not
one that you’re not able to avail yourself of because of the barriers.
The flavour of assisted digital will be as varied as the customer need, and I think that
we’re all collectively still on a journey of trying to understand that because of the
complexity and variety of government transaction. I think that the hardware interface is serving
as a barrier to a lot of people, so the intimidation of a keyboard or of a mouse, and as we transcend
into mobile touch-based interaction, that’s bringing down a lot of barriers for people.
So I think we’re going to see a significant shift as there is changes in hardware that
allow us to access that place that will open people’s mind to the possibility.
